did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: DeForest Douglas Diver Railroad Photographs, ca. 1870-1948
did.physdesc: Original photographs, glass plates and other negatives, glossy prints.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Original photographs, glass plates and other negatives, and glossy prints, mainly of the New York, Ontario, and Western Railway, taken by Mr. Diver and others in Delaware, Madison, Oneida, Oswego, Otsego, and Sullivan Counties, New York.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: A collection of DeForest Douglas Diver, 1878-1958, railroad engineer and photographer, consisting of original photographs, glass plates and other negatives, and glossy prints, mainly of the New York, Ontario, and Western Railway. Subjects include employee groups, locomotives, passenger and freight cars, stations at Middletown and elsewhere, roundhouse and yards at Middleton, flooded and snowbound tracks, construction work and heavy equipment, the Hawk Mountain tunnel, and various wrecks. Photographs were taken by Mr. Diver and others at Cadosia, Cooks Falls, Fishs Eddy, Sidney, Delaware County; Morrisville, Oneida, Randallsville, Solsville, Madison County; Clinton, Oneida County; Constantia, Fulton, Oswego County; South New Berlin, Otsego County; Callicoon, Ferndale, Hankins, Hurleyville, Liberty, Summitville, Sullivan County.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York, Ontario, and Western Railway Co.

altformavail.head: Available Copies:
altformavail.p: Photographs from the collection have been digitized and are accessible through Cornell Library's Flickr site: http://www.flickr.com/photos/cornelluniversitylibrary/collections/72157621733952250/ .
Photographs from the collection are also accessible through the RMC image portal..

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: DeForest Douglas Diver Railroad Photographs, #1948. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

odd.head: Additional information on contents of Diver RR Photograph Collection

list.item: Collection does NOT include a picture of inspection locomotive #28 (see letter from Leonard Rice, 9/7/63).
For checklist of boxcar photos made 2/64, see attached list.
For checklist of N.Y.O. & W. engine and vestibule chair car photos made 4/66, see attached list.
